meanings.definition: The action of refusing to allow something.
meanings.sent1: The disallowance of entry to the party upset him.
meanings.sent2: The disallowance of pets in the building is clearly stated in the lease agreement.
meanings.sent3: The disallowance of dessert before dinner caused a mini-revolt among the kids.
meanings.sent4: Her disallowance of any distractions during study time turned her room into a fortress of focus.
meanings.sent5: The disallowance of electronic devices during the exam made the room eerily quiet.

meanings.definition: The act of not permitting or approving something.
meanings.sent1: The disallowance of late submissions was clearly communicated to the students.
meanings.sent2: The disallowance of smoking in the building is strictly enforced.
meanings.sent3: The disallowance of using the elevator for only one floor seemed silly but had a good reason.
meanings.sent4: His disallowance of negativity in his life was like a shield against bad vibes.
meanings.sent5: The disallowance of outside food in the cinema made the popcorn smell even more tempting.
